citation.article-title: Four new species of the genus Actinokineospora: Actinokineospora inagensis sp. nov., Actinokineospora globicatena sp. nov., Actinokineospora terrea sp. nov., Actinokineospora diospyrosa sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Actinokineospora diospyrosa sp. nov.
Actinokineospora diospyrosa (di.o.spy'ros.a. M. L. adj. diospyrosa, pertaining to the fruit tree Diospyros kaki)
Morphological, physiological, and chemotaxonomic characteristics are the same as those given above for A. inagensis.
In addition, the organism grows well on yeast extract-malt extract agar (ISP medium 2), Bennett's agar, and Bennett's agar containing maltose.
The temperature range for growth is 12 to 32°C, and good growth occurs at temperatures between 22 and 29°C.
In general, the vegetative mycelia are tan, and the aerial mycelia are white to gray.
Does not grow in the presence of 4% NaCl.
Fructose, arabinose, sucrose, mannose, maltose, and rhamnose are slightly utilized as carbon sources, but inositol, xylose, mannitol, raffinose, galactose, lactose, and glucitol are not utilized.
The G+C content of the DNA of the type strain is 69.3 mol%.
The major menaquinone is MK-9(H4), and a small amount of MK-8(H4) is also present.
